name: 철도시스템 인터페이스
contents: 1. 일반사항1.1 목적(1) 이 기준은 철도시스템 인터페이스에 대하여 조사, 계획, 설계, 시공, 유지관리에 필요한 기술적 사항을 제시하는 것을 목적으로 한다.1.2 적용 범위내용 없음1.3 참고 기준내용 없음1.4 용어의 정의내용 없음1.5 기호의 정의내용 없음1.6 설계 고려사항1.6.1 분야별 인터페이스 사항 조치 1.6.1.1 인터페이스처리 기준(1) 분야별 인터페이스 조치사항은 협의(공식문서, 회의록) 결과를 기준으로 정리하는 것을 원칙으로 한다.  (2) 타 분야와 협의가 어려운 경우(협의기관 미확정, 공정상 분야별 협의가 불가한 사항)에는 보고서에 추가 협의를 할 수 있도록 미협의 내용을 명기한다.(3) 더불어, 설계도서에는 해당공종의 관련분야와 협의시공을 할 수 있도록 도면에 표기(NOTE)한다.1.6.1.2 공동관로(1) 공동관로는 토목분야와 전기분야가 다음 사항을 협의하여 설계하여야 한다.① 공동관로는 선로 좌우측에 각각 설치하며 전철전력용, 신호제어용, 정보통신용으로 분류하여야 한다.② 공동관로의 재질은 철근 콘크리트로 하며, 관련규격(KS)에 적합한 내력(강도)으로 설계하며 뚜껑의 재질 및 크기는 전선의 보호, 보수요건을 고려하여 설계한다.③ 공동관로 간 접속 부분 또는 공동관로와 맨홀, 핸드홀의 접속 부분에는 설치류 등의 동물이 침입하지 않도록 하여야 한다.④ 공동관로의 크기는 해당분야의 전선을 모두 수용할 수 있도록 하며, 공동관로 내에 포설하는 전선의 점유율은 공동관로 내단면적의 50% 이내로 한다.⑤ 터널과 교량구간 및 접속개소에는 공동관로의 신축율을 고려하여야 한다.⑥ 공동관로는 전철전력용, 신호제어용 및 정보통신용 전선로 구분과 화재시의 안전을 위해 격벽을 설치하여야 한다.⑦ 공동관로는 원활한 전선 입선작업과 유지보수를 위하여 일정간격으로 점검구를 설치하여야 한다.(2) 공동구는 전철전력용, 신호제어용, 정보통신용 전선을 각각 분리하여 포설 및 유지보수할 수 있도록 구축하여야 한다.1.6.1.3 관제설비(1) 정보통신설비에서 열차집중제어설비(CTC)와 원격제어설비(SCADA)로 제공하는 데이터통신회선에 대하여 협의한다.(2) 관제설비 설계를 위해 협의하여야 할 사항은 다음과 같다.① 열차집중제어설비(CTC)에서 운행정보시스템으로 제공하는 열차운행정보② 열차집중제어설비(CTC)에서 여객안내설비로 제공하는 열차행선안내정보③ 운행정보시스템에서 열차무선설비로 제공하는 열차운행 스케쥴④ 열차집중제어설비(CTC)에서 원격제어설비(SCADA)로 제공하는 열차운행정보⑤ 원격제어설비(SCADA)에서 열차집중제어설비(CTC)로 제공하는 표준시각정보⑥ 원격제어설비(SCADA)에서 열차집중제어설비(CTC)로 제공하는 전차선단선정보1.6.1.4 기능실(1) 전기분야 기능실 관련 협의사항은 다음과 같다.① 기능실, 전원실의 면적은 시설물을 설치할 수 있는 충분한 면적을 확보하여야 한다.② 신호기계실과 운전취급실은 가능한 동일 건물 내에 근접되게 배치한다.③ 기능실의 바닥은 이중마루로 설계하는 것을 원칙으로 하며 주변 여건에 따라 대체 설계할 수 있다.④ 통신실에는 이중마루 위에 무전도타일로 마감되도록 설계하여야 한다.⑤ 기계실 및 전원실의 바닥에는 현장케이블을 수용할 수 있는 충분한 크기의 케이블인입구를 설치하여야 한다.⑥ 각 기계실 및 전원실의 출입문은 장비 반입이 용이하도록  건축분야와 협의하여야 한다.⑦ 각 기계실의 층고는 장비설치 및 유지보수에 충분하여야 한다.⑧ 전기분야 각 기능실에는 화재 발생 시 화재 확산을 막거나 억제시키는 소화설비 및 속보장치를 설치하여야 한다.(2) 전기분야 기능실의 단위 부담하중은 관련법규에 적합하고 지진운동에 의한 하중을 충분히 감당할 수 있어야 한다.1.6.2 전철전력분야 인터페이스1.6.2.1 전철전원-차량(1) 전철전원분야가 차량분야로부터 제공 받아야 할 인터페이스 사항은 다음과 같다.① 차량제원 및 열차운행 계획서(장래계획 포함)② 차량의 회생제동에 대한 제원③ 차량의 정차 또는 운행 시 EMI/EMC 발생기준④ 차량 운행 시 속도별 역률 데이터 및 고조파 발생량1.6.2.2 전철전원-노반(1) 전철전원분야가 노반분야로부터 제공 받아야 할 인터페이스 사항은 다음과 같다.① 노반 종.평면도② 단계별 공사추진계획 ③ 노반용지도 및 인허가 추진일정④ 차량편성길이, 출발 및 제동거리⑤ 구조물 종, 평면도(2) 전철전원분야가 노반분야에 제공 할 인터페이스 사항은 다음과 같다.① 인허가 병행추진용 자료1.6.2.3 전철전원-건축(1) 전철전원분야가 건축분야로부터 제공 받아야 할 인터페이스 사항은 다음과 같다.① 옥상층 평면도② 지하층 및 케이블 트랜치 평면도③ 진입로 개설계획도④ 변전실 기기평면도⑤ 출입문 및 울타리 시공 상세도⑥ 기기하중반영결과 내역⑦ 내진설계 검토결과서⑧ 기계소방설비 시공계획⑨ 기기실 내장재 검토서⑩ 건물피뢰침 설치검토서⑪ 건물접지 상세도(2) 전철전원분야가 건축분야에 제공 할 인터페이스 사항은 다음과 같다.① 송전선 가선계획도② 건물내 지중선로 구성계획도③ 반입용 장비제원④ 변전기기실 소요면적⑤ 기기설치 계획⑥ 트렌치 설치 및 기기실간 관통 계획⑦ 가공지선 시공계획⑧ 소내 접지설비 시공계획1.6.2.4 전철전원-전차선(1) 전철전원분야가 전차선분야로부터 제공 받아야 할 인터페이스 사항은 다음과 같다.① 전차선로 계통도② 절연구간설치조건 및 급전선인출 방안③ 구분장치 설치 조건 및 급전선 인출방안④ 인출모선 배치도⑤ 전차선로 각종 선종, 규격, 수량⑥ 인출선로 시공방식(가공 또는 지중)⑦ 지중인출로 상세도⑧ 매설접지시공 상세도(2) 전철전원분야가 전차선분야에 제공 할 인터페이스 사항은 다음과 같다.① 급전계통도② 기기배치도③ 위치현황도④ 전압강하 검토서⑤ 급전시뮬레이션 결과물⑥ 말단개소 변전설비도⑦ 인출설비 상세도1.6.2.5 전철전원-전력(1) 전철전원분야가 전력분야로부터 제공 받아야 할 인터페이스 사항은 다음과 같다.① 조명기기배치도② 비상조명등 설치계획③ 외등설치계획④ 소방설비 설치 및 운용계획⑤ 유도등 설치계획⑥ 구내배전선로 시공상세도⑦ 변전건물내 간선배선계획⑧ 전기실 평면도⑨ 전기실 배전반 배치 및 트랜치 평면도⑩ 피뢰침 설치계획⑪ 매설접지 시공평면도⑫ 피뢰침접지상세도(2) 전철전원분야가 전력분야에 제공 할 인터페이스 사항은 다음과 같다.① 변전소내 전력소요량② 변전기기 설치계획③ 건물배치계획④ 기기배치도⑤ 매쉬접지 평면도1.6.2.6 전철전원-신호제어(1) 전철전원분야가 신호제어분야로부터 제공 받아야 할 인터페이스 사항은 다음과 같다.① 궤도접지상세도② 궤도절연구간 시공도1.6.2.7 전철전원-정보통신(1) 전철전원분야가 정보통신분야로부터 제공 받아야 할 인터페이스 사항은 다음과 같다.① 통신회선구성방안② 무인화설비 시공계획③ 각종 전화설치계획(관제, 유선, 직통전화)④ 통신유도대책 대상설비 현황(2) 전철전원분야가 정보통신분야에 제공 할 인터페이스 사항은 다음과 같다.① 급전 계통도 및 급전구간평면도 : 유도대책용② 전철구간의 전기방식③ 송전선로 경과도④ 변전소(구분소)설치 계획⑤ 변전설비 시공 및 무인화 계획⑥ 변전소 평면계획⑦ 변전설비 및 외곽감시용 시스템 설치 계획1.6.3 전차선분야1.6.3.1 전차선-차량(1) 전차선분야가 차량분야로부터 제공 받아야 할 인터페이스 사항은 다음과 같다.① 차량제원(최고속도, 최대부하전류)② 전기차 운행계획 및 전차선로 급전계통도③ 역구내 선로배선 사용계획서④ 전차선로 배선결정서⑤ 차량검수계획, 검수고 운용계획⑥ 차량제원, 차량집전가능범위⑦ 팬터그래프 제원, 팬터 집전가능범위, 전기차 팬터운용방식(2) 전차선분야가 차량분야에 제공 할 인터페이스 사항은 다음과 같다.① 전차선로 설계기준 및 가선 시스템② 전차선로 급전계통도③ 전차선로가선범위 협의서④ 검수고내 전차선로 가선도⑤ 절연구분장치 설치도, 전차선로평면도⑥ 전차선 높이기준, 편위기준, 전차선로 표준장주도1.6.3.2 전차선-노반(1) 전차선분야가 노반분야로부터 제공 받아야 할 인터페이스 사항은 다음과 같다.① 노반설계기준, 사업기본계획② 노반단계별시공도, 운행선 변경계획③ 노반설계기준, 선로평면도④ 터널, 교량, 옹벽, U램프 단면도 및 상세시공도⑤ 토목지장물 배치도⑥ 특수선 시공도 ,과선교 구조도⑦ 매설접지 계통도, 지하매설물 위치도⑧ 터널 단면도, 터널구간 C찬넬 설치도(2) 전차선분야가 노반분야에 제공 할 인터페이스 사항은 다음과 같다.① 전차선로설계기준② 전차선로 평면도, 전주별 장주도③ 케이블 포설도④ 매설접지선 시공도, 전차선로 평면도1.6.3.3 전차선-궤도(1) 전차선분야가 궤도분야로부터 제공 받아야 할 인터페이스 사항은 다음과 같다.① 궤도설계기준, 궤도평면도 및 궤도단계별 시공도     ② 선로종단면도, 선로평면도③ 교각 위치, 분기기위치④ 운행선 변경계획(2) 전차선분야가 궤도분야에 제공 할 인터페이스 사항은 다음과 같다.① 전차선로 설계기준, 전차선로 단계별 시공도② 표준장주도, 전차선로평면도1.6.3.4 전차선-건축(1) 전차선분야가 건축분야로부터 제공 받아야 할 인터페이스 사항은 다음과 같다.① 역사건물 구조도② 건물배치도③ 건축물(승강장지붕) 구조도(평면도)④ 선상역사시공도⑤ 역사 주단면도, 지장 전철주 현황도⑥ 변전건물 입면도, 평면도(2) 전차선분야가 건축분야에 제공 할 인터페이스 사항은 다음과 같다.① 전차선로 평면도② 겸용 전철주 시공도, 전차선로 하중1.6.3.5 전차선-전철전원(1) 전차선분야가 전철전원분야로부터 제공 받아야 할 인터페이스 사항은 다음과 같다.① 변전설비급전계통도② 정격전압 부하전류③ 인출모선 인출도, 변전기기배치도④ 동력단로기 원제설비 구성도(2) 전차선분야가 전철전원분야에 제공 할 인터페이스 사항은 다음과 같다.① 전차선로 평면도② 전차선로 급전 계통도1.6.3.6 전차선-전력(1) 전차선분야가 배치계획(2) 정보통신분야가 노반분야에 제공하여야 할 사항은 다음과 같다.① 통신관로도: 허용관로 곡률반경, 관로경간, 핸드홀과 횡단전선관 위치 및 규격② 광케이블 및 동케이블 포설 계획③ 선로변 통신설비 설치 위치 계획④ 장대터널 내 통신설비 설치 위치 계획⑤ 기지국 위치 및 면적확보 계획1.6.6.3 정보통신-건축(1) 정보통신분야가 건축분야로 부터 제공받아야 할 사항은 다음과 같다.① 건물 부지 평면 계획② 각 기능실 평면도 및 단면도, 상세도③ 승객 인출입 동선 계획④ 주 통신기기실 위치  및 면적⑤ 보조통신기기실, 전원실 및 통신전용 수직피트실 위치 및 면적⑥ 냉난방기 설치 및 용량 계획⑦ 통신기기실내 소화설비 구성 및 속보설비 ⑧ 전기동차가 운행되는 지하구간 승강장(스크린도어)의 경우 영상감시장치 모니터 수용에 관한 설치위치, 면적 등 인터페이스 사항(2) 정보통신분야가 건축분야에 제공하여야 할 사항은 다음과 같다.① 통신기기실 및 부속실 필요 면적② 통신기기실 내부건축 요구사항(바닥, 창, 천정 등)③ 통신설비 배치 계획④ 건물내 통신설비 기기기초 위치 및 규격1.6.6.4 정보통신-전철전원(1) 정보통신분야가 전철전원분야로 부터 제공받아야 할 사항은 다음과 같다.① 급전 계통도  및 급전구간평면도: 유도대책용② 전철구간의 전기방식③ 송전선로 경과도④ 변전소(구분소)설치 계획⑤ 변전설비 시공 및 무인화 계획⑥ 변전소 평면계획⑦ 변전설비 및 외곽감시용 시스템 설치 계획(2) 정보통신분야가 전철전원분야에 제공하여야 할 사항은 다음과 같다.① 원격제어 통신회선 계획: SCADA설비 및 변전감시용 영상감시회선② 관제전화 설치 계획③ 전기시계 시각정보 및 동기클럭정보1.6.6.5 정보통신-전차선(1) 정보통신분야가 전차선분야로 부터 제공받아야 할 사항은 다음과 같다.① 전차선로 평면도 및 장주도② 절연구분장치 위치③ 전차선설비 감시센서 등을 위한 통신회선 수요④ 교량 및 터널, 토공 접지단자함 설치 계획 및 위치(2) 정보통신분야가 전차선분야에 제공하여야 할 사항은 다음과 같다.① 터널 내 누설동축케이블 설치 위치 및 높이1.6.6.6 정보통신-전력(1) 정보통신분야가 전력분야로 부터 제공받아야 할 사항은 다음과 같다.① 전원구성방안② 분전함 위치③ 전원계통도 및 배전전원 용량표(전원공급계획)④ 공용접지 구성도(공통접지 단자위치도)⑤ SCADA 원격제어회선 구성계획 및 제어 프로토콜⑥ 통신기기실 내 자동화재 탐지설비 및 원격제어 구성계획 (2) 정보통신분야가 전력분야에 제공하여야 할 사항은 다음과 같다.① 관제전화 회선 및 원격제어회선 계획② 전기시계 시각정보 및 동기클럭정보③ 통신설비 소요 전원 용량④ 공용접지 사용 계획1.6.6.7 정보통신-신호제어(1) 정보통신분야가 신호분야로부터 제공받아야 할 사항은 다음과 같다.① DTS 전송망 사용계획② 콘솔데스크 제작사양 및 사용 계획③ 열차운행정보, 열차스케쥴 정보④ CTC 구성 통신회선 및 제어 프로토콜(2) 정보통신분야가 신호분야에 제공하여야 할 사항은 다음과 같다.① CTC 제어회선 및 관제전화회선② 통신단자함 위치③ 공동관로 사용계획④ 전기시계 시각정보 및 동기클럭 정보2. 조사 및 계획내용 없음3. 재료내용 없음4. 설계내용 없음
contents_en: 1. General Provisions 1.1 Purpose (1) This standard aims to provide the technical requirements necessary for investigation, planning, design, construction, and maintenance of railway system interfaces. 1.2 Scope: None 1.3 No reference standard available 1.4 Definition of Terms - Not applicable No definition available for the 1.5 symbol. 1.6 Design Considerations 1. Actions regarding field-specific interfaces 6.1 1. 6. 1.1 Interface Handling Standards (1) Interface measures by field shall be organized based on the results of consultations (official documents, meeting minutes) as a general rule. (2) In cases where consultation with other fields is difficult (unconfirmed consultation agency, items where field-specific consultation is impossible due to process), the report shall specify the uncoordinated items to allow for further consultation. (3) Furthermore, the design documents shall indicate (NOTE) on the drawings to ensure coordination with related fields for the relevant work. 1. 6. 1.2 Common Duct System (1) The common duct system shall be designed through consultation between the civil engineering and electrical engineering sectors. ① The common duct system shall be installed on both sides of the track and classified for electric railway power, signal control, and information communication purposes. ② The material of the common duct system shall be reinforced concrete, designed with strength (load-bearing capacity) conforming to relevant standards (KS), and the material and size of the cover shall be designed considering the protection and maintenance requirements of the cables. ③ Measures shall be taken to prevent the intrusion of rodents and other animals into the connection points between common ducts or the connection points between the common duct system and manholes or handholes. ④ The size of the common duct system shall be sufficient to accommodate all cables in the relevant field, and the occupancy rate of the cables laid within the common duct system shall not exceed 50% of the cross-sectional area of the common duct system. ⑤ In tunnels, bridges, and connection sections, the thermal expansion and contraction of the common duct system shall be considered. ⑥ The common duct system shall be equipped with partitions to separate electric railway power, signal control, and information communication cable routes and to ensure safety in the event of a fire. ⑦ Inspection openings shall be installed at regular intervals in the common duct system to facilitate cable routing and maintenance. (2) Common trenches shall be constructed to allow for the separate laying and maintenance of electric railway power, signal control, and information communication cables. 1. 6. 1.3 Control Facilities (1) Coordinate regarding the data communication lines provided from the Train Central Control Facility (CTC) and the Remote Control Facility (SCADA) via the information and communication facilities. (2) The following shall be coordinated for the control facility design: ① Train operation information provided from the Train Central Control Facility (CTC) to the Operation Information System ② Train destination guidance information provided from the Train Central Control Facility (CTC) to the Passenger Guidance Facility ③ Train operation schedule provided from the Operation Information System to the Train Radio Facility ④ Train operation information provided from the Train Central Control Facility (CTC) to the Remote Control Facility (SCADA) ⑤ Standard time information provided from the Remote Control Facility (SCADA) to the Train Central Control Facility (CTC) ⑥ Overhead contact wire status information provided from the Remote Control Facility (SCADA) to the Train Central Control Facility (CTC) 1. 6. 1.4 Functional Rooms (1) Coordination Matters Related to Electrical Functional Rooms are as follows: ① Functional rooms and power rooms shall secure sufficient area to accommodate the installation of equipment. ② Signal control rooms and operation rooms should be located as closely as possible within the same building. ③ The floor of functional rooms shall be designed as a double-floor system, but alternative designs may be adopted depending on the surrounding conditions. ④ Communication rooms shall be designed with a wireless tile finish on top of the double floor. ⑤ Cable inlets of sufficient size to accommodate field cables shall be installed on the floors of mechanical rooms and power rooms. ⑥ Entrances to each mechanical room and power room shall be coordinated with the architectural field to facilitate equipment installation. ⑦ The headroom of each mechanical room shall be sufficient for equipment installation and maintenance. ⑧ Each electrical functional room shall be equipped with fire suppression equipment and early warning devices to prevent or suppress the spread of fire in the event of a fire. (2) The unit load-bearing capacity of electrical functional rooms shall be in compliance with relevant regulations and capable of withstanding seismic loads. 1. Subway Power System Interface 1. 6. 2.1 Traction Power - Vehicle (1) The interface items that the traction power sector must receive from the vehicle sector are as follows: ① Vehicle specifications and train operation plan (including future plans) ② Specifications for vehicle regenerative braking ③ EMI/EMC emission standards during vehicle stopping or operation ④ Speed-dependent power factor data and harmonic generation during vehicle operation. 1. 6. 2.2 Electrical Power for Railway - Subgrade (1) The interface items that the electrical power for railway sector shall receive from the subgrade sector are as follows: ① Subgrade alignment and profile drawings ② Phased construction plan ③ Subgrade map and permit schedule ④ Train formation length, departure and braking distance ⑤ Structure alignment and profile drawings (2) The interface items that the electrical power for railway sector shall provide to the subgrade sector are as follows: ① Materials for concurrent permit application 1. 6. 2.3 Traction Power - Architecture (1) The interface requirements that the traction power sector must receive from the architectural sector are as follows: ① Rooftop plan ② Underground floor and cable trench plan ③ Access road construction plan ④ Switchgear equipment layout plan ⑤ Entrance door and fence construction details ⑥ Equipment load reflection details ⑦ Seismic design review report ⑧ Mechanical fire protection system construction plan ⑨ Equipment room interior finish review ⑩ Building lightning protection installation review ⑪ Building grounding details (2) The interface requirements that the traction power sector shall provide to the architectural sector are as follows: ① Overhead transmission line plan ② Underground cable route configuration plan within the building ③ Equipment specifications for delivery ④ Required area of the switchgear room ⑤ Equipment installation plan ⑥ Trench installation and inter-room penetration plan ⑦ Overhead ground wire construction plan ⑧ On-site grounding system construction plan 1. 6. 2.4 Traction Power - Overhead Contact Line (1) The interface items that the traction power sector must receive from the overhead contact line sector are as follows: ① Overhead contact line system diagram ② Isolation section installation conditions and overhead catenary withdrawal plan ③ Switchgear installation conditions and overhead catenary withdrawal plan ④ Main withdrawal busbar layout diagram ⑤ Overhead contact line types, specifications, and quantities ⑥ Withdrawal line construction method (aerial or underground) ⑦ Underground withdrawal details ⑧ Buried grounding construction details (2) The interface items that the traction power sector will provide to the overhead contact line sector are as follows: ① Power supply system diagram ② Equipment layout diagram ③ Location overview diagram ④ Voltage drop assessment report ⑤ Power supply simulation results ⑥ Terminal substation diagram ⑦ Withdrawal equipment details 1. 6. 2.5 Subway Power Supply - Power (1) The interface items that the subway power supply sector must receive from the power sector are as follows: ① Lighting Equipment Layout ② Emergency Lighting Installation Plan ③ Outdoor Lighting Installation Plan ④ Fire Protection Equipment Installation and Operation Plan ⑤ Emergency Guide Lighting Installation Plan ⑥ Indoor Wiring Diagram Details ⑦ Main Wiring Plan within the Substation Building ⑧ Electrical Room Floor Plan ⑨ Electrical Panel Layout and Trench Floor Plan ⑩ Lightning Protection Installation Plan ⑪ Buried Grounding Construction Plan ⑫ Lightning Grounding Details (2) The interface items that the subway power supply sector shall provide to the power sector are as follows: ① Power Requirements within the Substation ② Substation Equipment Installation Plan ③ Building Layout Plan ④ Equipment Layout Diagram ⑤ Mesh Grounding Floor Plan 1. 6. 2.6 Traction Power - Signal Control (1) The interface requirements that the traction power section must receive from the signal control section are as follows: ① Track grounding details ② Construction diagrams between track sections. 1. 6. 2.7 Traction Power - Information and Communications (1) The interface items that the Traction Power sector needs to receive from the Information and Communications sector are as follows: ① Communication line configuration plan ② Unmanned facility construction plan ③ Various telephone installation plan (control, wired, direct telephone) ④ Status of facilities subject to communication interference countermeasures (2) The interface items that the Traction Power sector needs to provide to the Information and Communications sector are as follows: ① Power supply system diagram and power section plan view: for interference countermeasures ② Electrical grounding of the railway section ③ Route of transmission lines ④ Substation (branch substation) installation plan ⑤ Substation equipment construction and unmannedization plan ⑥ Substation plan view ⑦ Substation equipment and perimeter surveillance system installation plan 1. 6.3 Overhead Contact Line Field 1. 6. 3.1 Overhead Line-Rolling Stock (1) Interfaces that the overhead line section must receive from the rolling stock section are as follows: ① Vehicle specifications (maximum speed, maximum traction current) ② Electric vehicle operation plan and overhead catenary system diagram ③ Track layout usage plan within a station ④ Overhead catenary wiring diagram ⑤ Vehicle inspection plan, inspection yard operation plan ⑥ Vehicle specifications, pantograph collection range ⑦ Pantograph specifications, pantograph collection range, electric vehicle pantograph operation method (2) Interfaces that the overhead line section shall provide to the rolling stock section are as follows: ① Overhead catenary design criteria and contact wire system ② Overhead catenary system diagram ③ Overhead catenary span coordination agreement ④ Catenary diagram within the inspection yard ⑤ Third rail sectioning device installation diagram, overhead catenary plan view ⑥ Overhead catenary height standard, deviation standard, overhead catenary standard span. 1. 6. 3.2 Overhead Line - Subgrade (1) The following interface items shall be provided by the subgrade sector to the overhead line sector: ① Subgrade design standards, basic business plan ② Subgrade construction drawings by stage, track alignment change plan ③ Subgrade design standards, track alignment plan ④ Cross-sections and detailed construction drawings of tunnels, bridges, retaining walls, and U-ramps ⑤ Location of civil obstructions ⑥ Special track construction drawings, overpass structure drawings ⑦ Buried grounding system diagrams, location of underground utilities ⑧ Tunnel cross-sections, C-channel installation diagrams for tunnel sections (2) The following interface items shall be provided by the overhead line sector to the subgrade sector: ① Overhead line design standards ② Overhead line plan, tower-specific tower drawings ③ Cable laying diagrams ④ Buried grounding wire construction drawings, overhead line plan 1. 6. 3.3 Overhead Line-Track (1) The interface items that the overhead line sector must receive from the track sector are as follows: ① Track design criteria, track plan, and track stage-by-stage construction drawings ② Track cross-section view, track plan ③ Bridge pier location, switch location ④ Operating line change plan (2) The interface items that the overhead line sector shall provide to the track sector are as follows: ① Overhead line design criteria, overhead line stage-by-stage construction drawings ② Standard support structure, overhead line plan 1. 6. 3.4 Overhead Line - Architecture (1) The interface requirements that the overhead line sector must receive from the architecture sector are as follows: ① Historical building structural drawings ② Building layout plans ③ Structural drawings (floor plans) of buildings (platform roofs) ④ Construction drawings of elevated historical stations ⑤ Historical main sectional views, existing conditions drawings of underground utility poles ⑥ Elevation and floor plans of the substation building (2) The interface requirements that the overhead line sector must provide to the architecture sector are as follows: ① Overhead line plan view ② Construction drawings of combined utility poles, overhead line load. 1. 6. 3.5 Catenary-Traction Power (1) The interface requirements that the catenary area must receive from the traction power area are as follows: ① Substation and feeding system diagram ② Rated voltage and load current ③ Withdrawal busbar withdrawal diagram and switchgear layout diagram ④ Power circuit breaker primary equipment configuration (2) The interface requirements that the catenary area shall provide to the traction power area are as follows: ① Catenary route plan ② Catenary feeding system diagram 1. 6. 3.6 Overhead Contact Line - Power (1) The interface requirements that the overhead contact line sector must receive from the power sector are as follows: ① Power cable route diagrams, power cross-route construction diagrams ② Power manhole construction diagrams, power cable route diagrams ③ Buried grounding wire construction diagrams ④ Power circuit breaker power supply system diagrams (2) The interface requirements that the overhead contact line sector shall provide to the power sector are as follows: ① Overhead contact line plan, pole-by-pole support structure diagrams 1. 6. 3.7 Overhead Line - Signal Control (1) The interface requirements that the overhead line sector must receive from the signal control sector are as follows: ① Signal track diagram, signal cable duct route, signal cross-sectional route, and signal manhole construction drawing ② Signal track diagram impedance bond layout ③ Signal track diagram, signal equipment layout (2) The interface requirements that the overhead line sector provides to the signal control sector are as follows: ① Overhead line plan ② Pole-specific pole stay diagram ③ Overhead line plan and buried grounding system diagram 1. 6. 3.8 Overhead Contact Line - Information and Communications (1) The interface requirements that the overhead contact line sector must receive from the information and communications sector are as follows: ① Communication cable routes, ② Communication equipment layout. (2) The interface requirements that the overhead contact line sector must provide to the information and communications sector are as follows: ① Overhead contact line plan and tower location diagram, ② Location of sectionalizing disconnect switches, ③ Communication circuit requirements for overhead contact line equipment monitoring sensors, ④ Plans and locations for grounding terminal boxes on bridges, tunnels, and earthworks, ⑤ Buried grounding system diagrams. 1. 6.4 Power Sector 1. 6. The following interfaces that the power sector needs to receive from the vehicle sector are as follows. ① Train operation plan. 1. 6. 4.2 Power-Civil Engineering (1) The interface items that the power sector shall receive from the civil engineering sector are as follows: ① Project route plan and longitudinal/plan view ② Civil engineering schedule ③ Tunnel plan view and cross-section view ④ Substation planned location civil engineering site usage plan ⑤ Electrical-related civil construction plan ⑥ Station and cargo home plan view ⑦ Fire prevention facility plan within the tunnel ⑧ Longitudinal view of the tunnel section (2) The interface items that the power sector shall provide to the civil engineering sector are as follows: ① Underground conduit construction drawings ② Power facility plan within the tunnel 1. 6. 4.3 Power-Railway (1) The interface requirements that the power sector shall receive from the railway sector are as follows. ① Electrical-related civil construction plan. 1. 6. 4.4 Power-Architecture (1) The following interface requirements shall be provided by the architectural field to the power field: ① Construction plan for the building ② Cooling and heating installation plan for the distribution room ③ Layout and floor plan of the distribution room ④ Building longitudinal section view ⑤ Platform and station floor plan ⑥ Elevator installation floor plan ⑦ Installation plan for various equipment piping ⑧ Load capacity and material specifications of various equipment 1. 6. 4.5 Power-Substation Power (1) The interface requirements that the power sector must receive from the substation power sector are as follows: ① Construction plan related to the internal power supply of the substation equipment ② Power requirements of various equipment (2) The interface requirements that the power sector shall provide to the substation power sector are as follows: ① Power requirements for the electrical room control power. 1. 6. 4.6 Power-Overhead Line (1) The interface items that the power sector shall receive from the overhead line sector are as follows: ① Overhead line standard pole layout ② Buried grounding construction plan (2) The interface items that the power sector shall provide to the overhead line sector are as follows: ① Distribution line route map 1. 6. 4.7 Power-Signal Control (1) The interface requirements that the power sector must receive from the signal control sector are as follows: ① Signal equipment load requirements ② Necessity of backup power ③ Signal equipment installation plan (2) The interface requirements that the power sector shall provide to the signal control sector are as follows: ① Power configuration plan ② Distribution panel location ③ Common grounding configuration diagram 1. 6. 4.8 Power-Telecommunications (1) The following interface requirements shall be provided by the telecommunications sector to the power sector: ① Control telephone lines and remote control lines plan ② Electrical clock visual information and synchronous clock information ③ Communication equipment required power capacity ④ Common grounding usage plan ⑤ Broadcasting facility construction plan (2) The following interface requirements shall be provided by the power sector to the telecommunications sector: ① Common duct usage plan ② Distribution panel location ③ Common grounding configuration diagram (common grounding terminal location diagram) ④ SCADA remote control line configuration plan and control protocol ⑤ Automatic fire detection equipment and remote control configuration within the telecommunications equipment room 1. 6.5 Signal Control Field Interface 1. 6. 5.1 Signal Control - Vehicle (1) The following information shall be provided to the signal control sector by the vehicle sector: ① Maximum speed of the track and vehicle for selecting signal control facilities ② Vehicle braking performance ③ Vehicle specifications ④ On-board equipment information transmission protocol (2) The following information shall be provided by the signal control sector to the vehicle sector: ① Ground equipment information transmission protocol 1. 6. 5.2 Signal Control - Subgrade (1) Items that the signal control sector needs to receive from the subgrade sector are as follows: ① Duct bank volume ratio ② Tunnel cross-section for securing space for signal equipment installation ③ Bridge width for signal equipment installation ④ Drainage plan within the station area ⑤ Wiring plan within the station area ⑥ Subgrade longitudinal and plan sections (2) Items that the signal control sector needs to provide to the subgrade sector are as follows: ① Location and space plan for signal control equipment installation within long tunnels ② Required duct bank volume ratio ③ Signal control equipment installation plan for bridge structures 1. 6. 5.3 Signal Control - Track (1) Items that the signaling sector must receive from the track sector are as follows: ① Track laying drawings ② Effective gauge and subsidiary facility installation plan for main line and side line ③ Vehicle contact limit marker location ④ Switch type and number ⑤ Wiring diagrams for confirming architectural limitations ⑥ Phased construction plan ⑦ Shunting signal marker installation location ⑧ Adhesive insulated rail installation plan ⑨ New seam device installation plan ⑩ Lateral shoulder width for securing facility installation space ⑪ Track plan between stations (2) Items that the signaling sector must provide to the track sector are as follows: ① Insulator joint plate installation diagram ② Electric track switch installation plan 1. 6. 5.4 Signal Control - Architecture (1) Requirements to be provided to the Signal Control field by the Architectural field are as follows: ① Location and area of the signal machinery room ② Location and area of the power room ③ Location and area of the operation room ④ Pit installation plan ⑤ HVAC installation plan ⑥ Floor plans and sections of each functional room ⑦ Location of distribution panels (2) Requirements to be provided by the Signal Control field to the Architectural field are as follows: ① Required area of the signal machinery room ② Required area of the power room ③ Location and required area of the operation room ④ Heat generation of the signal machinery room and power room 1. 6. 5.5 Signal Control - Overhead Line (1) The following items shall be provided to the Signal Control sector by the Overhead Line sector: ① Location of track isolation device ② Buried grounding line system diagram (ground terminal box location diagram) ③ Location of traction pole dry cell (2) The following items shall be provided by the Signal Control sector to the Overhead Line sector: ① Track circuit diagram ② Common grounding plan 1. 6. 5.6 Signal Control - Power (1) The following items are required from the Power sector by the Signal Control sector: ① Location of power supply plan, ② Location of shared conduit usage plan, ③ Distribution panel location, ④ Shared grounding diagram. (2) The following items are to be provided by the Signal Control sector to the Power sector: ① Signal equipment load requirements, ② Necessity of backup power, ③ Signal equipment installation plan, shared grounding diagram. 1. 6. 5.7 Signal Control - Information and Communications (1) The following are the items that the signal control sector needs to receive from the information and communications sector: ① CTC control circuit and supervisory telephone circuit ② Communication terminal location ③ Shared duct usage plan (2) The following are the items that the signal control sector needs to provide to the information and communications sector: ① DTS transmission network usage plan ② Console desk specifications and usage plan ③ Train operation information, train schedule information ④ CTC configuration communication circuit and control protocol. 1. 6.6 Information and Communication Technology Interface 1. 6. 6.1 Information and Communication - Vehicle (1) The following information should be provided to the Information and Communication sector from the Vehicle sector: ① Driver's seat and cubicle detailed drawings ② Power car cable routing diagrams ③ Possible locations for installing vehicle-mounted antennas (2) The following information should be provided by the Information and Communication sector to the Vehicle sector: ① Specifications of train wireless equipment (equipment and ANT size, system diagrams, wiring diagrams) ② Train wireless equipment protocol 1. 6. 6.2 Information and Communication - Civil Engineering (1) Items that the Information and Communication sector should receive from the Civil Engineering sector are as follows: ① Topographic maps, cross-sectional drawings, longitudinal sectional drawings, geological survey reports, existing obstacle survey, and civil construction schedule ② Grounding plan for bridges and tunnels ③ Architectural limits for straight and curved sections ④ Common duct installation plan ⑤ Location and width of tunnel ballast bed installation ⑥ Station interior wiring plan and building layout plan (2) Items that the Information and Communication sector should provide to the Civil Engineering sector are as follows: ① Communication duct map: allowable duct curve radius, duct span, location and specifications of handholes and cross-ducts ② Optical cable and copper cable laying plan ③ Location plan for communication facilities along the track ④ Location plan for communication facilities within long tunnels ⑤ Base station location and area securing plan 1. 6. 6.3 ICT-Architecture (1) Items that the ICT sector needs to receive from the architectural sector are as follows: ① Site layout plan ② Floor plans, sections, and details of each functional room ③ Passenger access and egress flow plan ④ Location and area of the main communication equipment room ⑤ Location and area of auxiliary communication equipment rooms, power rooms, and dedicated communication vertical shafts ⑥ Plan and capacity of air conditioning equipment ⑦ Configuration and alarm system of fire suppression equipment inside the communication equipment room ⑧ For underground sections with electric trains operating, interface items such as installation location, area, etc., regarding the accommodation of video surveillance monitor systems. (2) Items that the ICT sector needs to provide to the architectural sector are as follows: ① Required area of communication equipment rooms and ancillary rooms ② Internal architectural requirements of communication equipment rooms (floor, windows, ceiling, etc.) ③ Communication equipment layout plan ④ Location and specifications of equipment foundations for communication facilities within the building. 1. 6. 6.4 Information and Communications - Substation Power (1) The following items shall be provided to the Information and Communications sector from the Substation Power sector: ① Emergency power system diagrams and emergency section plan: for inductive countermeasures ② Electrical protection of railway sections ③ Route of transmission lines ④ Substation (branch substation) installation plan ⑤ Construction and automation plan for substation equipment ⑥ Substation layout plan ⑦ Installation plan for substation equipment and external monitoring system (2) The following items shall be provided by the Information and Communications sector to the Substation Power sector: ① Remote control communication line plan: SCADA equipment and substation monitoring video monitoring line ② Control telephone installation plan ③ Electrical clock visual information and synchronous clock information 1. 6. 6.5 Information and Communication - Overhead Line (1) Items that the Information and Communication sector needs to receive from the Overhead Line sector are as follows: ① Overhead line plan and span chart ② Location of track circuit splitter ③ Communication circuit requirements for overhead equipment monitoring sensors, etc. ④ Installation plan and location of grounding terminal boxes for bridges, tunnels, and earthworks (2) Items that the Information and Communication sector needs to provide to the Overhead Line sector are as follows: ① Installation location and height of leak-proof coaxial cable within tunnels. 1. 6. 6.6 Information and Communication - Power (1) The following items shall be provided to the Information and Communication sector from the Power sector: ① Power configuration plan ② Distribution panel location ③ Single-line diagram and distribution power capacity table (power supply plan) ④ Common grounding configuration diagram (common grounding terminal location diagram) ⑤ SCADA remote control circuit configuration plan and control protocol ⑥ Automatic fire detection equipment and remote control configuration plan within the communication equipment room (2) The following items shall be provided by the Information and Communication sector to the Power sector: ① Control telephone circuit and remote control circuit plan ② Time information from electric clock and synchronous clock information ③ Communication equipment required power capacity ④ Common grounding usage plan 1. 6. 6.7 Information and Communication - Signal Control (1) Items that the Information and Communication sector should receive from the Signal sector are as follows: ① DTS transmission network usage plan ② Console desk specifications and usage plan ③ Train operation information, train schedule information ④ CTC configuration communication lines and control protocol (2) Items that the Information and Communication sector should provide to the Signal sector are as follows: ① CTC control lines and control telephone lines ② Communication terminal box location ③ Shared duct usage plan ④ Electrical clock time information and synchronous clock information 2. Survey and planning contents: None 3. Material contents: None 4. Design contents: None
